Package com.berthoud.project3oc.gameclasses

Class Game2

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.berthoud.project3oc.gameclasses.Games
      • com.berthoud.project3oc.gameclasses.Game2
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Game2ModeChallenger, Game2ModeDefender
    public abstract class Game2
extends Games
    Abstract class for Mastermind. It contains all the instance fields and methods required for all modes of Game2

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      protected int[] codeInputUser()
      This method inputs the code entered by the player on the keyboard, tests that the code is only made of digits, that the length of the input is identical to the value of instance field Games.nbDigitsand additionally tests that the nb of variations is valid Games.nbVariations
      (package private) int getDigitsFound()  
      (package private) int getDigitsPresent()  
      private boolean inputInsideRange​(java.lang.String inputUser, int nbVariations)
      This method is only required to test the validity of input player for game 2.
      protected int[] randomCodeGenerator()
      This methods generates a random code made of X digits, X being equal to value of Games.nbDigits.
      (package private) boolean testIsCodeFound()
      This method sets the instance field Games.isCodeFound() to true if all the digits have been found at the right position
      (package private) int[] validation​(byte[] codeToBeFound, int[] codeProposal)
      This method overloads validation(int[], int[]) and takes as parameter Games.codeToBeFound as a byte array instead of int array.
      (package private) int[] validation​(int[] codeToBeFound, int[] codeProposal)
      This methods compares codeTobeFound to codeProposal and return a validation indicating the number of digits found (right digits on the right positions) and digits present (right digits on the wrong position)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game2

        Game2​(int nbDigits,
      int maxGuesses,
      int nbVariations)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        nbDigits - number of digits of the code
        maxGuesses - max number of guesses allowed
        nbVariations - number of value possible for each digit. Min = 4 , Max = 10

    • Method Detail

      • getDigitsFound

        int getDigitsFound()

      • getDigitsPresent

        int getDigitsPresent()

      • validation

        int[] validation​(int[] codeToBeFound,
                 int[] codeProposal)
        This methods compares codeTobeFound to codeProposal and return a validation indicating the number of digits found (right digits on the right positions) and digits present (right digits on the wrong position)
        Parameters:
        codeToBeFound - the secret code
        codeProposal - the code attempt
        Returns:
        a two dimensional int array. 1st array for number of digits found and 2nd array for numbers of digit present

      • validation

        int[] validation​(byte[] codeToBeFound,
                 int[] codeProposal)
        This method overloads validation(int[], int[]) and takes as parameter Games.codeToBeFound as a byte array instead of int array.
        Parameters:
        codeToBeFound - the secret code
        codeProposal - the code attempt
        Returns:
        a two dimensional int array. 1st array for number of digits found and 2nd array for numbers of digit present

      • randomCodeGenerator

        protected int[] randomCodeGenerator()
        This methods generates a random code made of X digits, X being equal to value of Games.nbDigits. Each digit can take Games.nbVariations different values.
        Specified by:
        randomCodeGenerator in class Games
        Returns:
        the random code

      • testIsCodeFound

        boolean testIsCodeFound()
        This method sets the instance field Games.isCodeFound() to true if all the digits have been found at the right position
        Returns:
        true if the code has been found

      • codeInputUser

        protected int[] codeInputUser()
        This method inputs the code entered by the player on the keyboard, tests that the code is only made of digits, that the length of the input is identical to the value of instance field Games.nbDigitsand additionally tests that the nb of variations is valid Games.nbVariations
        Specified by:
        codeInputUser in class Games
        Returns:
        a valid code entered by the player

      • inputInsideRange

        private boolean inputInsideRange​(java.lang.String inputUser,
                                 int nbVariations)
        This method is only required to test the validity of input player for game 2. The method is called within the method codeInputUser()
        Parameters:
        inputUser - Code entered by the player
        nbVariations - Number of values that each digit can possibly take. Only required for game 2
        Returns:
        true or false
